page.title: 03OLD TIMERS 2
page.content: The vast majority of newcomers seem to retain their inner city mentality and keep themselves very much to themselves. Which is fine whilst the person concerned is living in the city, but tends to upset the inhabitants of a closely integrated village. Unless many more of these young people start taking an interest in the community life going on around them, instead of just using the vllage as a place to commute to and from work, relationships will not improve to any great extent. The old people of the village miss the ability they used to have of being able to walk into almost any house in the village, just for a chat. And that is a great shame.
